seo.title: Chiesa Nuova/Bar Internazionale to Hostel Brikette
seo.description: Micro‑route from the Chiesa Nuova stop to the hostel with minimal stairs; luggage tips and alternatives.

linkLabel: Chiesa Nuova/Bar Internazionale to Hostel Brikette
intro: Arriving by bus? “Chiesa Nuova” or “Bar Internazionale” is the closest stop to the hostel. This micro-route minimises stairs for knees and luggage.

image.alt: Positano's Chiesa Nuova SITA stop outside Bar Internazionale
image.caption: Positano (Chiesa Nuova) stop — wait outside Bar Internazionale; arrive a little early in summer as buses can fill quickly.

sections.title: Why this stop works
body: The bus stop outside the cafe/bar called Bar Internazionale is roughly 120 metres (400 feet) from Hostel Brikette — about a 3-minute walk.
This is the closest SITA bus stop to the hostel, with minimal stairs (just the entrance staircase).

sections.title: Walking directions from Bar Internazionale to the hostel
body: Exit the bus at the Bar Internazionale stop on Viale Pasitea (also called the Chiesa Nuova stop).
Walk along Viale Pasitea in the direction towards Montepertuso/Chiesa Nuova for approximately 120 metres (400 feet). You'll walk along the paved sidewalk on the right side of the road.
After about 3 minutes, look for the Hostel Brikette entrance on your right – you'll see a short staircase leading up to reception. There's a terrace-level sign before the entrance stairs.
Ascend the stairs to reach the main door and reception.

sections.title: Bus timing & tickets
body: Buy SITA tickets at the tabacchi near the stop or validate pre-bought tickets on boarding; keep a spare for late-night returns.
Evening buses thin out after 22:00—check the timetable in advance and aim for the second-to-last service to avoid taxi prices.

beforeList: Check SITA schedules in advance so you are not waiting on the roadside for the last service.
Validate your ticket as soon as you board—inspectors fine unvalidated tickets even for short rides.
Message the hostel if you are arriving after midnight so overnight staff can keep the door code handy.
stepsList: Exit the bus at Bar Internazionale stop and walk along Viale Pasitea towards Montepertuso/Chiesa Nuova.
Continue on the paved sidewalk for 120 metres (400 feet, about 3 minutes) – follow the walking route in the map below.
Look for the Hostel Brikette entrance on your right with a terrace-level sign, then take the stairs up to reception.
kneesList: The entire walk is paved with only one short staircase at the entrance.
If slopes bother your knees, take short breaks—traffic slows naturally on the bend.
kneesPorterPrefix: Need a hand with heavy bags?

faqs.q: Is there a sidewalk the whole way?
faqs.a: Yes — the route uses the main road pavement, avoiding long staircases.
Street lighting is present; use your phone torch for extra visibility on alleys.

faqs.q: How long does the walk take?
faqs.a: About 3 minutes from Bar Internazionale to the hostel entrance (120 metres/400 feet).

faqs.q: Will I be able to find the entrance easily?
faqs.a: Yes – look for the terrace-level Hostel Brikette sign on your right as you walk along Viale Pasitea. The entrance staircase is clearly marked and leads up to reception.

howtoSteps: From 'Chiesa Nuova' stop, walk 2–5 minutes to the hostel
Use the fewest‑stairs alleyways; avoid long staircases
If carrying heavy bags, consider porter pickup at the stop
